pullRequest.body:
This adds a class `TietzeExtension` to encode the Tietze extension theorem as a type class that can be satisfied by various types. For now, we provide instances for `‚Ñù`, `‚Ñù‚â•0`, `‚ÑÇ`, `IsROrC ùïú`, pi types, product types, as well as constructors via homeomorphisms or retracts of a `TietzeExtension` space, and also a constructor for finite dimensional topological vector spaces. 

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I'll give this a deeper look soon, but a first comment:

> note: we'll leave IsROrC ùïú for a future PR because this is a rare case where we're going to do things backwards and prove it first for ‚Ñù and ‚ÑÇ, and then use those for the IsROrC version.

Why not provide an instance/reducible-def for finite dimensional T2 real TVS, by reducing it to products using [LinearEquiv.toContinuousLinearEquiv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Module/FiniteDimension.html#LinearEquiv.toContinuousLinearEquiv). Then it will apply directly to `IsROrC`, right?

@ADedecker I've implemented your nice suggestion. It can't be an instance because there is no way for Lean to know which scalar field is intended, so it's just a theorem.

Optionally, I could provide in additional an *actual* instance, where the scalar field is just assumed to be `IsROrC`. This would allow us to get `TietzeExtension (EuclideanSpace ùïú n)` for free. (EDIT: I've added this instance)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7918957923/job/21618613222)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7918957923/job/21618613734)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7918957923/job/21618614400)

This condition follows from the special case, where `X‚ÇÅ` is a closed set in `X‚ÇÇ`, saving us a universe parameter. I'm not sure if this property for `X‚ÇÅ X‚ÇÇ : Type v` implies it for any universe.

BTW, is there a natural version of this typeclass that implies `exists_extension_forall_mem_of_closedEmbedding` below? E.g., can we prove that a nonempty convex set in a finite dimensional space has the `TietzeExtension` property?

I've implemented the universe parameter reduction.

As for nonempty convex sets in a finite dimensional space, the answer should be *yes*, even with the version I've implemented. The key thing you would need to show is that the nonempty convex set is a retract of the full space. Can we leave that for a future PR, possibly with a TODO?
Can we reformulate versions of Tietze Extension theorem like "exists an extension of bounded norm" as "the closed ball is a Tietze extension space"? And same for an `OrdConnected` subset of `Real`.

@urkud, yes and no.

Yes: you can prove `TietzeExtension (Metric.closedBall (0 : E) r)` but ...

No: only for `0 ‚â§ r` and so it wouldn't fire as an instance.

I think the solution, as I've worked out in the latest commit, is to prove the theorem above, and then use it in the proof of `BoundedContinuousFunction.exists_norm_eq_restrict_eq`. Let me know if this is the generality you're looking for.

The same goes for `OrdConnected` (you need the set to be nonempty, so it won't trigger as an instance), but since this applies only to sets in `‚Ñù`, I think it's fine to leave these more specialized results on their own as is.

Note: I did not change this back to `awaiting-review` because it's a bit sloppy at the moment, and I need to clean it up, but I wanted to get your thoughts on whether you think this approach is adequate.
Shouldn't this be a `(priority := low)` instance?
you mean because Lean will always search for `Module ?ùïú E`? Or because we already have instances for `‚Ñù` and `‚ÑÇ`?

As far as I understand, instances that don't have fixed head symbol (e.g., `Œ± √ó Œ≤` or `IsROrC k`, because we only have 2 instances) should have low priority so that Lean apply type-specific instances first (in this case, instances for `Real`, `Complex`, `Prod`, and functions).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add a `TietzeExtension` class
